meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes trouble or distress.
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbor was a besetter with their constant loud music.
meanings.sent2: The bully at school was a relentless besetter to the other students.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became a besetter by stealing all the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: The storm was a fierce besetter, causing damage to the town.
meanings.sent5: The persistent besetter of problems made life difficult for everyone.

meanings.sent1: The persistent rain besettered the farmers, delaying their harvest.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site besettered the residents.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat besettered the dog by stealing its toys.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories besettered her dreams every night.
meanings.sent5: The relentless waves besettered the shore, eroding the coastline.
